home.coverText:
Welcome to the
future of no nonsense
transactions!

parallax.first: Myriadcoin is an open source, truly decentralized, digital currency that can be sent peer-to-peer over the internet.
parallax.second: There are no intermediaries, no chargebacks and most importantly you control your money.

nonsense.title: There are a lot of coins and a lot of claims so it can be hard to spot what’s real and what’s nonsense.
nonsense.caption: Here are some things to look out for:

premining.title: Pre-mining
premining.body: <0>Pre-mining means mining many coins before the cryptocurrency is launched to the public. This means the developer or creator of the coin could create a high demand for a coin but then inflate it by selling a high volume of pre-mined coins for their gain.</0><0>Myriadcoin has not been pre-mined.</0>

asic_farms.title: ASIC-farms
asic_farms.body: <0>ASIC miners can in some ways remove decentralization from a cryptocurrency. Large mining farms could pontentially give someone the capability to control the future development of the network.</0><0>By using multiple algorithms Myriadcoin’s multi algorithm approach offers exceptional 51% resistance because a range of different hardware is needed to find 51% of the blocks.</0>

ico.title: ICO
ico.body: <0>Initial Coin Offerings (ICOs) is a method for cryptocurrencies to raise funding for their development. By offering people to buy in to the currency before it launches to the open market. During 2017 and 2018 ICO also become a popular for scammers and people around the world to promise good things but in the end leaving the investors empty handed.</0><0>Myriadcoin have never done an ICO.</0>

secure_storing.title: No secure storing
secure_storing.body: <0>One of the biggest problems with many cryptocurrencies is that they dont offer secure storing, either by using cold storage or be available on hardware wallets.</0><0>Myriadcoin have cold wallets available for both iOS and Android.</0>

no_development.title: No development happening
no_development.body: <0>Keeping a coin up to date with the current BIPs of Bitcoin and having a community of contributors is a crucial part of have a successful cryptocurrency. To make sure the interest is high but also to make use of the currency in new and exiciting ways.</0><0>Myriadcoin has a number of contributors from all around the world moving it forward.</0>

pump_and_dump.title: Pump and dump-moves
pump_and_dump.body: <0>When only a few people own large stakes in a cryptocurrency it is common that there is a lot of pump-and-dump moves going on.</0><0>By being open to the public from the start and the coins being spread out across the community this is prevented.</0>

non_vibrant_communities.title: Non-vibrant communities
non_vibrant_communities.body: <0>The Myriadcoin community is spread all over the world and has a thriving community on Reddit and Telegram.</0><0>Real world example use of Myriadcoin can be found in the Esperanto community.</0>

trusted.title:
Trusted, secure and
up-to-date
trusted.body: Myriadcoin's unique multi-algorithm approach means that it has extra resistance to 51% attacks.

community.title:
Community-driven with
democratic decision making
community.body: No one and everyone controls Myriadcoin. It’s a community driven project that is using mining consensus for implementing changes.

fair.title: Fair distribution and mining
fair.body: Myriadcoin has no pre-mine or IPO and was fairly launched. Myriadcoin uses a long mining period, which prevents a large portion of the coins to be consolidated in the hands of very few.

attacks.title: 51% Attack Resistance
attacks.body: Thanks to our multi algorithm approach.

multi-algo.title: Multi-algorithm
multi-algo.body: SHA256d, Scrypt, Myr-Groestl, Argon2d and Yescrypt.

longblocks.title: Longblocks
longblocks.body: Increased security, less orphans, higher difficulty.

esperanto.title: Saluton!
esperanto.body: Myriadcoin is used to support content creators in the Esperanto community

community.title: Got any questions or just wanna chat?

map.title: Nodes around the world
map.description: Myriadcoin has nodes all over the world. The following map shows public nodes, i.e nodes that help distribute the blockchain and that anyone can connect to. Join the network you too by making your full node public.

blocks_mined.title: Blocks Mined
blocks_mined.description: The number of blocks mined on each of Myriadcoin’s algorithms.

mining_difficulty.title: Mining Difficulty
mining_difficulty.description: The average mining difficulty for each of Myriad's algorithms.

hash_rate.title: Hash Rate
hash_rate.description: The estimated number of hashes per second the Myriadcoin network is performing.

transactions.title: Transactions
transactions.description: The number of transactions made on the Myriadcoin network (excluding coinbase transacions).

mined_coins.title: Mined Coins
mined_coins.description: The number of mined coins during the interval.

inflation.title: Yearly Inflation
inflation.description: The yearly inflation rate for the coins mined during the interval.

top.title: Five mining algorithms makes all the difference
top.body: <0>Myriadcoin addresses the issues with mining centralization, 51% attacks and unfair distribution with a multi-algorithm blockchain.</0><0>Using five different mining algorithms may seem like a simple addition but let’s explore more in depth what it really means.</0>

items.text: Myriadcoin was launched by 8bitcoder, forked from Zetacoin. It was the first cryptocurrency to use five proof-of-work algorithms in an effort to increase security as well as broaden the base of people who could mine it - SHA256d and Scrypt for ASIC miners, Skein and Myr-Groestl for GPU miners, and Qubit for GPU and CPU miners.
Myriadcoin hard-forked to allow merge-mining on its SHA256d and Scrypt algorithms in an effort to improve security and achieve a more stable hashrate on those two algorithms.
Myriadcoin 0.11.3.1 is released changing the ticker from MYR to XMY and signaling replacement of Qubit to Yescrypt using mining consensus.

Mining consensus is reached and Myriadcoin succeeds to replace the Qubit algorithm with the Yescrypt algorithm to preserve mining decentralization. Myriadcoin became the first cryptocurrency to use mining consensus to change a mining algorithm.

Longblock is implemented via MIP 3. A gradual increase in block time from 1 to 8 minutes using multiple intervals of block time adjustments. Coin supply and emission rate vs clock time is made sure not to be affected. It is later activated using consensus bit 5.
Algoswap2 is implemented via MIP 4. Swapping Skein to Argon2d. The change is later activated using mining consensus (consensus bit 6).
Myriadcoin 0.18.1.0 is released with improved multi-wallet support and RISC-V support. 0.00000001 XMY is now defined as octibit or obi.

items.title: Multi-Algo
items.value: Scrypt, SHA256D, Yescrypt, Argon2d and Myriad-Groestl

software_and_pools.title: Software and pools
software_and_pools.body: <0>Myriadcoin supports a handful of different mining softwares. You can choose from the list below for what algorithm you want to mine with depending on how your mining rig or device is setup.</0>

wallet.body: Do not store your cryptocurrency on an exchange. Use one of these wallets instead.

buy.title: Buy Myriadcoin
buy.body: To get your hands on your first Myriadcoin you need to use an exchange. You can buy Myriadcoin with fiat money or exchange another cryptocurrency for Myriadcoin.

fair.title: Aren’t all cryptocurrencies fairly distributed and mined?

top.title: No one and everyone controls Myriadcoin.
top.body: Myriadcoin is a community driven project full of volunteers. For large changes in Core mining consensus is used. This principle works because of Myriads decentralized mining.

social_media.title: Social media
social_media.body: We are also on <2>Bitcointalk</2> and on our own <6>IRC channel</6>

wallet.github: Checkout the Github repository for more info
wallet.homepage: Checkout the website for more info

SHA256d.label: SHA256d
SHA256d.description: You may use any SHA256d compatible ASIC

scrypt.label: Scrypt
scrypt.description: You may use any Scrypt compatible ASIC

myr-groestl.label: Myr-Groestl
myr-groestl.description: If you mine using Myr-Groestl, you have a few options

argon2d.label: Argon 2D
argon2d.description: Argon2 is a key derivation function that was selected as the winner of the Password Hashing Competition in July 2015. Argon2d maximizes resistance to GPU cracking attacks. It accesses the memory array in a password dependent order, which reduces the possibility of time memory trade-off aka (TMTO) attacks, but introduces possible side-channel attacks.

yescrypt.label: Yescrypt
yescrypt.description: Yescrypt is a password-based key derivation function. It applies slow cryptographic operations to a password and salt, creating a key suitable for performing encryption or storage to validate the password in the future. Yescrypt algoritm is based on scrypt by Colin Percival of Tarsnap.
